PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I'm going to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> drinking beer. I'm so fat that I can't see my feet anymore!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I'm going to give up drinking beer. I'm so fat that I can't see my feet anymore!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Voy a dejar de beber cerveza. ¡Estoy tan gordo que no puedo ver mis pies ya!

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Rafa's    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   photography. He’s just bought one of the latest and most expensive digital cameras.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Rafa's taken up photography. He’s just bought one of the latest and most expensive digital cameras.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Rafa ha empezado fotografía. Se acaba de comprar la cámara digital más actual cara y cara.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I don’t know how my wife    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    me. I drink too much, I’m a bad husband and a I'm terrible person to live with.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I don’t know how my wife puts up with me. I drink too much, I’m a bad husband and a I'm terrible person to live with.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   No se como mi mujer me aguanta. Bebo mucho, soy un mal marido y una persona horrible con la que vivir.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: If you don’t <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> , we’ll miss the train!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: If you don’t hurry up , we’ll miss the train!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Si no te das prisa, ¡perderemos el tren!

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I’ve live in Madrid now, but I <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> in a small village in Argentina.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I’ve live in Madrid now, but I grew up in a small village in Argentina.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Ahora vivo en Madrid, pero crecí en un pueblo pequeño de Argentina

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Leave the dirty dishes until tomorrow. I’ll    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    in the morning.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Leave the dirty dishes until tomorrow. I’ll wash them up in the morning.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Deja los platos sucios hasta mañna. Los labaré por la mañana.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My parents find it very difficult to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> technology. The world is changing too fast for them.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My parents find it very difficult to keep up with technology. The world is changing too fast for them.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   A mis padres les cuesta estar al día con la tecnología. El mundo está cambiando demasiado rápido para ellos.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I’m going to bed early tonight. Tomorrow I have to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> at 6.30.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I’m going to bed early tonight. Tomorrow I have to wake up at 6.30.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Me voy a ir a la cama pronto esta noche. Mañana tengo qeu levantarme a las 6:30

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Please can you <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> the TV? I'm trying to study and it's really annoying me.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Please can you turn off / switch off the TV? I'm trying to study and it's really annoying me.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   ¿Puedes apagar la tele? Estoy intentado estudiar y me está molestando de verdad.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I’m    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> going on holiday next month. I really need a rest.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I’m looking forward to going on holiday next month. I really need a rest.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Estoy deseando ir de vacaciones el próximo verano. De verdad necesito un descanso.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Can I <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> this dress, please? I'm a size 10.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Can I try on this dress, please? I'm a size 10.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   ¿Puedo probarme este vestido, por favor? Tengo una talla 10.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Excuse me. What time does the plane to Madrid <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Excuse me. What time does the plane to Madrid take off
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Perdón. ¿A que hora despega el avión a Madrid?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Have you got a pen? I'd like to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   your email address and phone number.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Have you got a pen? I'd like to write down your email address and phone number.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  ¿Tienes un boli? Me gustaría apuntar tu email y teléfono.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Has your brother-in-law <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   the money you lent him last month?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Has your brother-in-law paid you back the money you lent him last month?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   ¿Te ha devuelto tu cuñao el dierno que le prestaste el mes pasado?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Do you <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   your boss?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Do you get on with your boss?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   ¿Te llevas bien con tu jefe?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Tell the taxi driver to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    for a few minutes. I won't be long.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Tell the taxi driver to hold on for a few minutes. I won't be long.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Dile al taxista qeu espere unos minutos. No será mucho.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: We’ve    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    milk. Is black coffee ok?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: We’ve run out of milk. Is black coffee ok?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Nos hemos quedado sin leche. ¿Es café negor vale?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: The doctor told me to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    taking the pills.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: The doctor told me to carry on taking the pills.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  El doctor me dijo que siguiera tomando las pastillas.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I'm sorry I'm late. My car <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    on the motorway
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I'm sorry I'm late. My car broke down on the motorway
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Perdón llego tarde. Mi coche se estropeó en la autopista.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Why did you <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   my blue jeans? I know they were old, but they were really comfortable.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Why did you Throw away my blue jeans? I know they were old, but they were really comfortable.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  ¿Por qué tiraste mis pantalones azules? Se que eran viejos, pero eran muy cómodos.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: What were you <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   with David?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: What were you talking/speaking about with David?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  ¿De que estabas hablando con David?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I'm   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   for a few days on business next week.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I'm going away for a few days on business next week.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Me voy fuera unos días de viaje de negocios la próxima semana

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: We're   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   a flat in the city centre.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: We're looking for a flat in the city centre.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Estamos buscando un piso en el centro de la ciudad.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  my dad, but my sister   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   our mum.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I taking after my dad, but my sister taking after our mum.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Yo me parezco a mi padre, pero mi hermana se para a mi hermana.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: What time do you have to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  tomorrow?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: What time do you have to get up tomorrow?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   ¿A qué hora nos tenemos que levantar mañana?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: This shirt's too small. I'll have to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   tomorrow.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: This shirt's too small. I'll have to take it back tomorrow.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Esta camiseta es muy pequeña. Tendré que devolverla.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Sandra's off sick today, so we'll have to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   the meeting until next week.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Sandra's off sick today, so we'll have to put off the meeting until next week.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Sandra está enferma hoy, asi que tendremos que posponer la reunión hasta la semana que viene.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Please   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   and make yourself comfortable. Mr. Smith will be with you in a few minutes.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Please sit down and make yourself comfortable. Mr. Smith will be with you in a few minutes.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Por favor, sientate y ponte cómodo. Mr. Smith estará con usted en unos minutos.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I have to go to London on business for a few days. Would you mind   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   my cat while I'm away.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I have to go to London on business for a few days. Would you mind looking after my cat while I'm away.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Tengo que ir a Londres de negocios uno par de dias. ¿Te impotaría cuidar de mi cat mientras estoy fuera?.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: If you don't   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  on smoking, drinking and sex, you don't live longer. It just seems like it.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: If you don't cut down on smoking, drinking and sex, you don't live longer. It just seems like it.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Si no reduces el consumo de tabajo, bebida y sexo, no vivirás mucho. Parece que es así.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: It’s difficult to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  four children on a bus driver’s salary.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: It’s difficult to bring up four children on a bus driver’s salary.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Es difícil educar a 4 niños con un salario de conductor de autobús.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: If it’s raining this afternoon, can you   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  from work?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: If it’s raining this afternoon, can you pick me up from work?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -   Si llueve esta tarde, ¿podrías recogerme del trabajo?.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My parents expected me to be a doctor or lawyer. When I chose a career in writing, I felt like I had   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My parents expected me to be a doctor or lawyer. When I chose a career in writing, I felt like I had Let them down
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Mis padres esperaban de mi ser doctor o abogado. Cuando elegí una trayectoria en escritura, sentí como si los hubiese decepcionado.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: A drunk driver lost control of his car and crashed into a tree right in front of our house. Luckily no one was hurt, but we were all pretty   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: A drunk driver lost control of his car and crashed into a tree right in front of our house. Luckily no one was hurt, but we were all pretty shaken up
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Un conductor borracho perdió el control de su coche y lo estrellón contra un árbol justo en frente de nuestra casa. Por suerte nadie fue herido, pero estuvimos bastante afectados.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Joanna was upset that she didn't get into the university she wanted, but she   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   when she received a full scholarship to another excellent school
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Joanna was upset that she didn't get into the university she wanted, but she cheered up when she received a full scholarship to another excellent school
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Joanna estaba moleta ya que  no consigió entrar en la universidad que quería, pero se animó cuando recibió una beca completa para otra universidad excelente.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Mike and I agreed to meet at the cafe at 7 o'clock, but he never   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   I waited for an hour and then went home.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Mike and I agreed to meet at the cafe at 7 o'clock, but he never showed up I waited for an hour and then went home.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Mike y yo estuvimos de acuerdo en encontrarnos a las 7 en el café, pero el nunca apareció. Esperé una hora y entonces me fui a casa.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  really well with my dad. I feel like I can talk to him about anything.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I get along really well with my dad. I feel like I can talk to him about anything.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Me llevo muy bien con mi padre, siento que puedo hablar con él de cualquier cosa.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: She's so confident that she sometimes   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   as a little arrogant.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: She's so confident that she sometimes comes across as a little arrogant.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Ella es tan confiada que a veces puede dar la iempreser de ser un poco arrogante.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: We're going to drop by the hospital to see how Sheila's doing after her surgery. Would you like to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   ?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: We're going to drop by the hospital to see how Sheila's doing after her surgery. Would you like to come along ?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Vamos a parar en el hospital para ver como está Sheila despues de la cirugía. ¿Te gusta´ria acompañarnos?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: On Saturday I   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   friends for a barbecue at the beach
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: On Saturday I met up with friends for a barbecue at the beach
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  El sábado quedé con unos amigos para una barbacoa en la playa.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: If you don’t have his number, why don’t you   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    in the phone book?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: If you don’t have his number, why don’t you Look it up in the phone book?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Si no tienes su número, ¿porque no lo buscas en la agenda?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: The only reason you go to that horrible bar is to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    girls.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: The only reason you go to that horrible bar is to pick up girls.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  La única razón por la que vas a ese horrible bar es para ligar con chicas.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: It was so windy yesterday that my car alarm   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: It was so windy yesterday that my car alarm went off
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Hacía tanto viento ayer que la alarma de mi coche sonó.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Go to bed now if you don’t feel well, and I’ll   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    some hot chocolate.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Go to bed now if you don’t feel well, and I’ll Bring you up some hot chocolate.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Ve a la cama si no te sientes bien, y yo te subiré chocolate caliente.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Please   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    after you're finished using them.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Please put the scissors away after you're finished using them.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Por favor, coloca las tijeras despues de que acabes de usarlas.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: No, I didn't stay in a hotel. A friend of mine   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   for the night.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: No, I didn't stay in a hotel. A friend of mine put me up for the night.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  No, no me quedé en un hotel. Un amigo mío me dejó quedarme en su casa por la noche.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: You should get some rest. We have a long trip tomorrow and you don't want to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  while driving.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: You should get some rest. We have a long trip tomorrow and you don't want to nod off while driving.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Deberías descansar. Tenemos un largo viaje mañana y no quieres quedarte dormido mientras conduces.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I let my kids    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  until midnight so they could see the fireworks on New Year's
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I let my kids stay up until midnight so they could see the fireworks on New Year's
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Dejé a mis hijos quedarse despiertos hasta media noche, así pudiero vern los fuegos artificiales de Nuevo Año.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I can't find anyone to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  my dogs while I'm on vacation.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I can't find anyone to look after my dogs while I'm on vacation.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - No encuentro a nadie que cuide de mis perros mientras estoy de vacaciones.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I just spilled some soda on the table - can you hand me a paper towel to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  ?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I just spilled some soda on the table - can you hand me a paper towel to wipe it up ?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - He derramado soda en la mesa, ¿Puedes acercarme una toalla para limpiarlo?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: The eggs that were in the fridge went bad, so I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: The eggs that were in the fridge went bad, so I threw them away
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Los huevos que estaban en la nevera se pusieron malos, asi que los tiré.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    and eat the last piece of pizza - I don't want it.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Go ahead and eat the last piece of pizza - I don't want it.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Ve y comete el último trozo de pizza, no lo quiero.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Last Saturday I had to finish up some work. I don't have a key to the office, but the security guard    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Last Saturday I had to finish up some work. I don't have a key to the office, but the security guard let me in
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - El último sábado, tuve que terminar algo de trabajo. No tengo la llave de la oficina, pero el guardia de seguridad me dejó entrar.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My daughter is planning to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a very competitive gymnastics team.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My daughter is planning to try out for a very competitive gymnastics team.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mi hija está planeando intentar entrar en un equipo de gimnasia muy competitivo.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I'm not a fitness fanatic, but I do try to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    three times a week.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I'm not a fitness fanatic, but I do try to work out three times a week.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - No soy un fanático del fitnes, pero intento ejercitar tres veces por semana.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: We had to get our car professionally cleaned after my son    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    all over the back seat.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: We had to get our car professionally cleaned after my son threw up all over the back seat.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Tuvimos que manar a limpiar nuestro coche profesionalmente después de que mi hijo vomitara todo el asiento de atrás.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My weight has gone up and down for years. I just can't seem to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a diet.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My weight has gone up and down for years. I just can't seem to stick to a diet.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mi peso ha ido arriba y abajo durante años, no veo una dieta con la que quedarme.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My weight has gone up and down for years. I just can't seem to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a diet.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My weight has gone up and down for years. I just can't seem to stick to a diet.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mi peso ha ido arriba y abajo durante años, no veo una dieta con la que quedarme.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Do you    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    going for a walk, or is your stomach still hurting?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Do you feel up to going for a walk, or is your stomach still hurting?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - ¿Te sientes bien para ir a dar un paseo, o todavía te duele el estómago?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I could never be a vegetarian. It'd be impossible for me to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    hamburgers.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I could never be a vegetarian. It'd be impossible for me to give up hamburgers.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - ¿Te sientes bien para ir a dar un paseo, o todavía te duele el estómago?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Go to your bedroom NOW and    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    all your dirty clothes!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Go to your bedroom NOW and pick up all your dirty clothes!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - ¡Ve a tu habitación ahora y recoge toda tu ropa sucia!

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I’ve been given more work and I’m earning more money this month, so things are really    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I’ve been given more work and I’m earning more money this month, so things are really looking up
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - He hecho más trabajo y estoy ganando más dinero este mes, asi que las cosas está mejorando

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My parents hate talking about my job at the strip club, so please don’t    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My parents hate talking about my job at the strip club, so please don’t bring it up
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mis padres odian hablar sobre mi trabajo en el club de striptease, a si que por favor no saques el tema.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Our business hasn’t    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    yet, but it’s only the first year.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Our business hasn’t taken off yet, but it’s only the first year.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Nuestro negocio no ha tenido éxito todavía, pero solo es el primer año.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Many founders of successful companies have    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    of college to work on their businesses.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Many founders of successful companies have dropped out of college to work on their businesses.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Muchos fundadores de companías de éxitos han dejado el colegio para trabajar en sus negocios.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: If you can't go to the meeting, I'll send you an e-mail    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    the main points afterwards
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: If you can't go to the meeting, I'll send you an e-mail summing up the main points afterwards
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Si no puedes ir a la reunión, te mandaré un e-mail resumiendo los puntos principales despues.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I have plenty of time to finish writing this article. I don't have to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    until the end of the month.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I have plenty of time to finish writing this article. I don't have to turn it in until the end of the month.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Tengo suficiente tiempo para acabar de escribir este artículo. No tengo que entregarlo hasta final de mes.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: That new restaurant is    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>     free samples of their food to help attact customers.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: That new restaurant is giving out free samples of their food to help attact customers.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Ese nuevo restaurante está repartiendo muestras gratis de su comida para atraer clientes.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: It sounds like something's wrong with the engine. We should probably    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>     and take a look.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: It sounds like something's wrong with the engine. We should probably pull over and take a look.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Suena como is algo estuviera mal en el motor. Deberíamos aparcar en lado y mirar.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: You missed the exit - you need to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>     and drive back about 2 miles.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: You missed the exit - you need to turn around and drive back about 2 miles.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Te has pasado la parada, tienes que girar y conducir hacia aqui unas 2 millas.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I've got a lot of work to do right now, but I might be able to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>     for a few days next month.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I've got a lot of work to do right now, but I might be able to get away for a few days next month.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Tengo mucho trabajo que hacer ahora mismo, pero quizá podré hacer una escapada un par de días el próximo mes.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I had to pay $2000 to fix my car after it    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I had to pay $2000 to fix my car after it broke down
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Tuve que pagar $2000 para arreglar mi coche despues de que se estropease.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I was    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   three months ago, and I haven't been able to find work since.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I was laid off three months ago, and I haven't been able to find work since.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Me despidieron hace tres meses y no he sido capaz de encontrar trabajo desde entonces.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I joined the company as an intern and    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   for a whole year before being promoted.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I joined the company as an intern and slaved away for a whole year before being promoted.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Me uní a la companñia como interno y me maté a trabajar durante un año completo antes de ser ascendido.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I have an old computer. It takes forever to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I have an old computer. It takes forever to boot up
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Tengo un ordenador viejo. Tarda mucho en arrancar.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I need a place to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   my laptop, I only have 10 minutes of battery life left.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I need a place to plug in my laptop, I only have 10 minutes of battery life left.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Necesito un sitio para conectar mi portátil. Solo tengo 10 minutors de vida de la batería.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My dad's good with computers. He'll help you    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  your wireles network.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My dad's good with computers. He'll help you    <color=#5bd3de>set up</color>  your wireles network.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mi padre es bueno con ordenadores. Te ayudará a configurar la red wifi.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Oops, I must have    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  during the installation, because the program won't open.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Oops, I must have    <color=#5bd3de>mess up</color>  during the installation, because the program won't open.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Ups, debo de haberla fastidiado durante la instalación, ya que el programa no abre.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  to the top of the page. I want to read the first paragraph of this article again.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: <color=#5bd3de>Scroll up</color>  to the top of the page. I want to read the first paragraph of this article again.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Desplázate hacia arriba de la página. Quiero leer el primer párrafo de este artículo otra vez.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    the bus at the wrong stop and had to ask for directions.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I    <color=#5bd3de>got off</color>    the bus at the wrong stop and had to ask for directions.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Me bjaé en la parada de bus equivocada y tuve que preguntar por direcciones.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I only wanted to buy a small present for my mother, but everything in the store was so beautiful that I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    getting gifts for my entire family.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I only wanted to buy a small present for my mother, but everything in the store was so beautiful that I    <color=#5bd3de>ended up</color>    getting gifts for my entire family.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Solo quería comprar un regalo pequeño para mi madre, pero todo lo de la tienda era tan bonito que acabé comprando regalos para la familia entera.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: When I'm traveling, I prefer to    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    with locals rather than with other tourists.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: When I'm traveling, I prefer to    <color=#5bd3de>hang out</color>    with locals rather than with other tourists.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Cuando viajo, prefiero salir con gente del sitio más que con otros turistas.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My son wants to be a fireman when he    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My son wants to be a fireman when he    <color=#5bd3de>grows up</color>.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mi hijo quiere ser bombero cuando crezca.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: This project isn't very high priority, just do it whenever you can    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    to.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: This project isn't very high priority, just do it whenever you can    <color=#5bd3de>get around</color>    to.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Este proyecto no tiene mucha prioridad, hazlo solo cuando puedas tengas tiempo.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My ex-girlfriend    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    calling me and begging for another chance, so I finally blocked her number.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My ex-girlfriend    <color=#5bd3de>kept on</color>    calling me and begging for another chance, so I finally blocked her number.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Mi ex novia siguió llamándome y suplicar otra oportunidad, a si que al final la bloqué el número.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    and finish packing - we need to leave for the airport in ten minutes!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: <color=#5bd3de>Hurry up</color>    and finish packing - we need to leave for the airport in ten minutes!
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Date prisa y acaba de hacer las maletas, ¡tenemos que salir hacia el aeropuerto en 10 minutos!

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: Brenda won't be at work today - her father    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    just last night and she's taking care of the funeral arrangements.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: Brenda won't be at work today - her father    <color=#5bd3de>passed away</color>    just last night and she's taking care of the funeral arrangements.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Brenda no estará hoy en el trabajo, su padre fallecío justo anoche y está llevanod a caba todos lo necesario para el funeral

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: The negotiations took a long time and there were a few miscommunications during the process, but everything eventually    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    and we all agreed to the partnership.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: The negotiations took a long time and there were a few miscommunications during the process, but everything eventually    <color=#5bd3de>worked out</color>    and we all agreed to the partnership.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Las negociaciones llevaron mucho tiempo y hubo algunos malentendidos durante el proceso, pero al final todo funcionó y todos estuvimos de acuerdo con el colaborador.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I need the phone number for the restaurant. Could you <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> online?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I need the phone number for the restaurant. Could you <color=#5bd3de>look it up</color> online?
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Necesito el teléfon odel restaurante. ¿Puedes buscarlo en internet?

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I don't know if I've been accepted into the program yet - I should <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> in the next few days.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I don't know if I've been accepted into the program yet - I should <color=#5bd3de>find out</color> in the next few days.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - No se si he sido aceptada en el programa ya. Debería saberlo en los próximos días.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: I couldn't <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  the difference between the present perfect and the past perfect, so I had to ask my teacher.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: I couldn't <color=#5bd3de>figure out</color>  the difference between the present perfect and the past perfect, so I had to ask my teacher.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - No pude descubrir la diferencia entre el presente perfecto y el pasado perfecto, a si que tuve que preguntar a mi profesora.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: After I <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  I realized I'd forgotten to ask the travel agent an important question, so I called him back.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: After I <color=#5bd3de>hung up</color>  I realized I'd forgotten to ask the travel agent an important question, so I called him back.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: - Despues de colgar, me dí cuenta de que había olvidado preguntar al agente de viaje una importante pregunta, a si que le volví a llamar.

PhrasalVerbQuiz.Question: My son is lazy. I try to teach him about the importance of hard work, but I can't seem to <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  him.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Answer: My son is lazy. I try to teach him about the importance of hard work, but I can't seem to <color=#5bd3de>get through to</color>  him.
PhrasalVerbQuiz.Translation: -  Mi hijo es vago. Intento enseñarle lo importante del trabajo duro pero no consigo hacerselo entender.
